Description: Papyrus written with black ink with lower part of demotic legal text (the upper part is lost): writing on recto (18 ll.) and verso (1 l.). Loan of corn. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "date and names of parties lost; but probably they are the same as in 10484, which seems to be a counterpart of this document. The names of 4 witnesses at foot."
Curator's comments: Kaplony-Heckel, U., Das Getreide-Darlehn P. Haun. Inv. Demot. 2, in K. Ryholt (ed.), Acts of the seventh international conference of Demotic studies. Copenhagen, 2002, 243.Text 12 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (C.J. Martin/S.E. Thomas). Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (91894) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/91894)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: incomplete - upper part lost
